div.p: Governor, Dr. Alexander-Scott Provide Updates on State's Response to COVID-19 - Press Release, April 20, 2020.

Read the latest update regarding the "Guidance for the Wearing of Cloth Face Coverings at Work" from the Department of Business Regulation.
Executive Order 20-24 Twenty-first Supplemental Emergency Declaration - Requiring Cloth Face Masks at Work.Â
Resources and Guidelines from RI Department of Health:

ul.li: For information on getting tested, and what your test means, RI Department of Health (RI DOH) has set up a page for COVID-19 Testing for the General Public.
If you or someone you know has a general question, RI DOHÂ has activated a Coronavirus Information Line: 401-222-8022. Visit the RI Department of Health's website for more information.
See all of the Governor's press releases on the State Government Press Releases webpage here.
See all of the Governor's executive orders on www.governor.ri.gov here.

div.p: The following areÂ links for news and updates from the Town:

ul.li: We're in This Together - A message from the Town Manager with phone numbers to call for assistance.
CODE RED MESSAGE 04-17-2020 - Read the latest COVID-19 Urgent Alert.Â Read our flyer about how to register for futureÂ alerts or go to the registration page here.
Be aware about fraudulent scams being utilized in the Northeast area - according to the FBI-Boston/Providence Offices.
Stay vigilant to prevent the spread of the Coronavirus.Â - Important information for preventing the spread of COVID-19.
Burrillville Aging StrongerÂ - A Facebook page with resources for those aged 60 and over.
Online Services - Pay your taxes, license your dog or request a birth certificate. Click the link to take advantage of our many online services.
Trash and Recycling -Â Service on scheduleÂ and a request from Waste Management.
Presidential Preference Primary - UPDATED 4/21 - Rescheduled to June 2, 2020. State to send out mail ballot applications.
Grab & Go Lunches - Free to school kids 18 and under.
Resources forÂ Burrillville Businesses - List of resources including links on the Economic Development page.

div.p: There is a lot of information going around, not all of it true.Â Get your information and updates from a trusted local news agency.Â Don't rely on social media for information, go to the source.

A message from Col. Stephen Lynch, Burrillville Chief of Police:Â "Emergency Medical Services in the Town of Burrillville are following all protocols, guidelines, and recommendations per the Rhode Island Department of Health, Emergency Medical Services Division.Â The local Fire/EMS Districts in the Town of Burrillville are working with other town departments such as police and school department on a regular basis regarding this matter.Â Town Public Safety officials are meeting regularly to address any and all concerns regarding the Corona Virus."
